titleInfo.title: AMERICA'S SMALL BUSINESS TAX RELIEF ACT OF 2015--MOTION TO PROCEED

extension.searchTitle: AMERICA'S SMALL BUSINESS TAX RELIEF ACT OF 2015--MOTION TO PROCEED; Congressional Record Vol. 162, No. 52

congVote.result: Three-fifths of the Senators duly chosen and sworn having voted in the affirmative, the motion is agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: America's Small Business Tax Relief Act_Agreement
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: Senate began consideration of H.R. 636, to amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to permanently extend increased expensing limitations, after agreeing to the motion to proceed, and taking action on the following amendments proposed thereto:<P/>Thune/Nelson Amendment No. 3464, in the nature of a substitute.<P/>Thune (for Gardner) Amendment No. 3460 (to Amendment No. 3464), to require the FAA Administrator to consider the operational history of a person before authorizing the person to operate certain unmanned aircraft systems.<P/>Thune Amendment No. 3512 (to Amendment No. 3464), to enhance airport security.<P/>During consideration of this measure today, Senate also took the following action:<P/>By a unanimous vote of 98 yeas (Vote No. 40), three-fifths of those Senators duly chosen and sworn, having voted in the affirmative, Senate agreed to the motion to close further debate on the motion to proceed to consideration of the bill.

titleInfo.title: United States Senate Amendment Number 3458 (114th Congress)
AMERICA'S SMALL BUSINESS TAX RELIEF ACT OF 2015
